# Arithmetic operations

This folder contains extensions that help in performing basic arithmetic operations.

## Divide


**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to pass in two numbers as inputs and the output will be "number 1" divided by "number 2" (number 1/number 2).
**<u>How to Use</u>**:
1. Write a step: `Divide("number1","number2") returning $result`.
2. You can also pass in variables e.g. $var1, $var2.
3. Alternatively, you can also use the shorthand expression `Divide("2","1") returning $result`.




### Details
- **Description:** Divide two inputs
- **Inputs:** Num1,Num2
- **Resources:** 
- **Async:** false
- [Add to Production (Europe)](https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Divide&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Production (US)](https://app-us.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Divide&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Free trial](https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Divide&org=true&%3D)
## Multiply


**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to pass in two or more numbers as inputs and the output will be the product of the numbers.

**<u>How to Use</u>**:
1. Write a step: `Multiply("number1","number2") returning $result`.

2. You can also pass in variables e.g. $var1, $var2.

3. By default, the extension is set to subtract number 2 from number 1.

4. If you want to multiply more numbers, then you can modify the extension e.g.

   - s = Number(Num1) * Number(Num2) * Number(Num3);

   - s = Number(Num1) * Number(Num2) * Number(Num3) * Number(Num4);

   - You will also need to add the Num3, Num4 etc to the inputs above.
5. Alternatively, you can also use the shorthand expression `Multiple("1","2") returning $result`.




### Details
- **Description:** Multiply two inputs
- **Inputs:** Num1,Num2
- **Resources:** 
- **Async:** false
- [Add to Production (Europe)](https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Multiply&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Production (US)](https://app-us.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Multiply&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Free trial](https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Multiply&org=true&%3D)
## Subtract


**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to pass in two or more numbers as inputs and the output will be the difference of the numbers.

**<u>How to Use</u>**:
1. Write a step: `Subtract("number1","number2") returning $result`. 
2. You can also pass in variables e.g. $var1, $var2.
3. By default, the extension is set to subtract number 2 from number 1.
4. If you want to subtract more numbers, then you can modify the extension e.g.

   - s = Number(Num1) - Number(Num2) - Number(Num3);
   - s = Number(Num1) - Number(Num2) - Number(Num3) - Number(Num4);
   - You will also need to add the Num3, Num4 etc to the inputs above.
5. Alternatively, you can also use the shorthand expression `Subtract("2","1") returning $result`.




### Details
- **Description:** Subtract two inputs
- **Inputs:** Num1,Num2
- **Resources:** 
- **Async:** false
- [Add to Production (Europe)](https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Subtract&org=true&)
- [Add to Production (US)](https://app-us.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Subtract&org=true&)
- [Add to Free trial](https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Subtract&org=true&)
## Sum


**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to pass in two or more numbers as inputs and the output will be the sum of the numbers.
**<u>How to Use</u>**:
1. Write a step: `Sum("number1","number2") returning $result`.

2. You can also pass in variables e.g. $var1, $var2.

3. By default, the extension is set to add only 2 numbers.

4. If you want to add more numbers, then you can modify the extension e.g.

   - s = Number(Num1) + Number(Num2) + Number(Num3);

   - s = Number(Num1) + Number(Num2) + Number(Num3) + Number(Num4);

   - You will also need to add the Num3, Num4 etc to the inputs above.
5. Alternatively, you can also use the shorthand expression `Sum("1","2") returning $result`.




### Details
- **Description:** Add together up to two inputs
- **Inputs:** Num1,Num2
- **Resources:** 
- **Async:** false
- [Add to Production (Europe)](https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Sum&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Production (US)](https://app-us.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Sum&org=true&%3D)
- [Add to Free trial](https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Sum&org=true&%3D)
